alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:03PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...NORTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...SOUTHEASTERN ARMSTRONG...OHIO...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM EDT... At 1003 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Apollo to North Side Pittsburgh to near Wintersville. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Monroeville, McMurray, Greensburg, Weirton, McKeesport, Steubenville, Washington, Jeannette, Canonsburg, Vandergrift, Wellsburg, Apollo, West Liberty, Avella, Gastonville, and Shaler Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 16 and 20. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 48 and 72. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 35 and 63. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 54 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for east central Ohio...western, southwestern and west central Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland
